item.title: Benefits Open Enrollment (now through Nov 10th)
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: The Benefits Open Enrollment will run from Friday, 10/24 through Monday, 11/10. All Associates are eligible to change or add to their current plans. If you are satisfied with your medical benefit choice, no need to re-enroll. Enrollment is required if you participate in the Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA). The 2015 Benefits Guide will be distributed to [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Benefits Open Enrollment will run from Friday, 10/24 through Monday, 11/10.

All Associates are eligible to change or add to their current plans. If you are satisfied with your medical benefit choice, no need to re-enroll. Enrollment is required if you participate in the Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA). The 2015 Benefits Guide will be distributed to all eligible Field Associates in mailpacks on 10/22 and desk dropped to all eligible Associates on 10/24.

Your Resources:

  • ascena Benefits team, dressbarn HR team and ascena HR team
  • 2015 Benefits Guide
  • Intranet Benefits Page – My Benefits
  • Employee Self Service – ADP Benefits Portal Tool
  • Benefits Direct #800 240-7147 or ascenabenefits@ascenaretail.com
    • dedicated ascena Benefits Support Team Monday-Friday (10AM–8PM EST)

item.title: FIT INTO SUMMER CHALLENGE – WEEK TWO BONUS POINTS
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: WEEK 2 BONUS POINTS BEGIN MONDAY, JUNE 30TH! You can log in your points at the Active For Life Site HERE IT’S ALL ABOUT DRINKING PLENTY OF WATER This Week’s bonus points is all about HYDRATION! With all of the exercising you are doing it’s imperative that you drink plenty of water to replenish the body after sweating. [...]
item.content:encoded:
WEEK 2 BONUS POINTS BEGIN MONDAY, JUNE 30TH!

You can log in your points at the Active For Life Site HERE

IT’S ALL ABOUT DRINKING PLENTY OF WATER

This Week’s bonus points is all about HYDRATION! With all of the exercising you are doing it’s imperative that you drink plenty of water to replenish the body after sweating. But there are a great many other health benefits of being properly hydrated:

Please see the table below to determine how much water you need to be drinking each day.

1. Increases Energy & Relieves Fatigue – Since your brain is mostly water, drinking it helps you think, focus and concentrate better and be more alert. As an added bonus, your energy levels are also boosted!

2. Promotes Weight Loss – Removes by-products of fat, reduces eating intake (by filling up your tummy if consumed prior to meals), reduces hunger (hello natural appetite suppressant!), raises your metabolism and has zero calories!

3. Flushes Out Toxins – Gets rid of waste through sweat and urination which reduces the risk of kidney stones and UTI’s (urinary tract infections).

4. Improves Skin Complexion – Moisturizes your skin, keeps it fresh, soft, glowing and smooth. Gets rid of wrinkles. It’s the best anti-aging treatment around!

5. Maintains Regularity – Aids in digestion as water is essential to digest your food and prevents constipation.

6. Boosts Immune System – A water guzzler is less likely to get sick. And who wouldn’t rather feel healthy the majority of the time? Drinking plenty of water helps fight against flu, cancer and other ailments like heart attacks.

7. Natural Headache Remedy – Helps relieve and prevent headaches (migraines & back pains too!) which are commonly caused by dehydration.

8. Prevents Cramps & Sprains – Proper hydration helps keep joints lubricated and muscles more elastic so joint pain is less likely.

9. Puts You in a Good Mood – When the body is functioning at its best, you will feel great and be happy!

10. Save Money! – Water is FREE! Even if you choose bottled/filtered water, it’s STILL cheaper than that high sugar and fat-filled latte!

HOW MUCH WATER SHOULD I BE DRINKING?

We are asking that you drink the recommended amount listed below and accounting for the extra water you should drink if you are exercising. You should add 12 ounces of water to your daily total for every 30 minutes that you work out. So if you work out for 45 minutes daily, you would add 18 ounces of water to your daily intake. It may seem like a lot but consider the size of many water bottles that are 20 oz. or more! So if you are 150 pounds and need to drink 100 ounces before you exercise, that’s five 20 oz. bottles.

Weight

Ounces of Water Daily

100 pounds

67 ounces

110 pounds

74 ounces

120 pounds

80 ounces

130 pounds

87 ounces

140 pounds

94 ounces

150 pounds

100 ounces

160 pounds

107 ounces

170 pounds

114 ounces

180 pounds

121 ounces

190 pounds

127 ounces

200 pounds

134 ounces

210 pounds

141 ounces

220 pounds

148 ounces

230 pounds

154 ounces

240 pounds

161 ounces

250 pounds

168 ounces

item.title: NEW Summer Associates Blog: Week 2
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: Ciara Breen is majoring in Industrial Engineering and Engineering Management at South Dakota School of Mines and Technology 2015. She is working in Asset Protection as the Safety and Risk Summer Associate working on re-writing the Guide to Safety and ‘Safety Topics’, reaching out to the stores by answering safety questions or concerns as well as updating [...]
item.content:encoded:
Ciara Breen is majoring in Industrial Engineering and Engineering Management at South Dakota School of Mines and Technology 2015. She is working in Asset Protection as the Safety and Risk Summer Associate working on re-writing the Guide to Safety and ‘Safety Topics’, reaching out to the stores by answering safety questions or concerns as well as updating them of safety policy changes, helping with the roll-out of a new product that is being tested in two districts, and applying for America’s Safest Companies award.

Strozzi and SMART Sessions:

“As a summer associate in the Home Office, it is inspiring to see a smiling face greet you everywhere you go and I can’t help but think that is due to the positive leadership and tremendous commitment dressbarn shows to its valued associates.”

___________________________________________________________________________________

In our second week, the Summer Associates attended a Strozzi session; a word we had heard a lot about, and were still unfamiliar with. Standing in a circle, we were introduced to Strozzi by Denise Bailey, the session leader, by connecting with our mood. We were asked to express our mood in one word. This proved to be a difficult task as it was foreign for me to show vulnerability to my peers. We then moved into a practice known as ‘centering’. When you are centered, you are connected to yourself; you become more present to others and your mood, are more open to possibilities, and become focused on what you care about. We practiced being aware of our bodies and focused on how we were breathing and the areas we held stress – our shoulders, legs, neck, and hands. Once we became aware, we practiced relaxing those areas and let the stress and worries fall away.

Next we were led through a few exercises of walking around the room. Initially, everyone was unsure and didn’t make a lot of eye contact. We then did the same exercise and were asked to be more aware of the space of others, walking with our heads up, making eye contact and smiling. This showed a pleasant change in the group as I observed everyone seemed more confident in themselves. Continuing the same exercise, half of us were then told to pretend as if we were distracted by our phones while still moving around the room. After this exercise, we discussed that we collectively felt ignored by those that were distracted. In today’s world, it is very easy to shut out what is going on around you and be tuned in to your own device. I took away from that exercise how impersonal it was to come upon someone who was more involved in their phone and how important it is to walk with your head up, facing the world head-on. Since the initial Strozzi introduction, I have gone to a few other sessions and have been taught to be more aware of how I present myself, both in posture and poise, as well as my reactions to a ‘grab’, a situation that surprises you, and how reactions can be perceived differently than you intend.

The Summer Associates also went to a SMART Session and were introduced to the SMART Girl. Having worked at the store level for five years before coming to the Home Office, I have seen the evolution of dressbarn’s target customer. I greatly enjoyed the extensive research into who the SMART Girl is and what she wants as well as the planned surveys to continue to evolve with our SMART Girl. It is inspiring to see the new brand, vision, and glimpse into the future.

As a summer associate in the Home Office, it is inspiring to see a smiling face greet you everywhere you go and I can’t help but think that is due to the positive leadership and tremendous commitment dressbarn shows to its valued associates. I think that the mission of dressbarn and the BELIEVE values are clearly shown by offering the Strozzi leadership practice so the associates can grow as encouraging leaders, earning trust, and building relationships, both personally and professionally.

 

What is your go-to clothing apparel/accessory that makes you look and feel good?
I am a firm believer that nothing can stop a woman in an exceptionally fitted pair of jeans and a statement necklace!

EVERY WEDNESDAY EVENING AT 5:30PM (weather permitting) You must sign the Recreational Activity Release prior to participation Please sign and drop off the release in the tray in the Fitness Center. Russell Del’Re is our associate leader for this 2 ½ mile loop on the MacArthur Blvd. [...]
item.content:encoded:
ARE YOU LOOKING FOR A GREAT OUTDOOR PHYSICAL ACTIVITY?
HOW ABOUT JOINING OUR ASSOCIATE LED STRIDE RUN CLUB?
EVERY WEDNESDAY EVENING AT 5:30PM (weather permitting)

You must sign the Recreational Activity Release prior to participation
Please sign and drop off the release in the tray in the Fitness Center.

Russell Del’Re is our associate leader for this 2 ½ mile loop on the MacArthur Blvd. Corporate Path

We all meet in front of the db building.

Please email Katherine Adamenko if you are interested in participating.

item.title: Fit into Summer Activity Challenge Kickoff June 23rd
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: WELCOME TO OUR KICKOFF WEEK OF THE FIT INTO SUMMER 10 WEEK ACTIVITY CHALLENGE! Thanks to all the teams and participants who signed up! We have nearly 20 teams and almost 100 participants! Stay tuned each week for an update on the standings. The top three teams will choose a charity donation of $1,500, $1,000 and $500. The [...]
item.content:encoded:
WELCOME TO OUR KICKOFF WEEK OF THE FIT INTO SUMMER 10 WEEK ACTIVITY CHALLENGE!

Thanks to all the teams and participants who signed up!

We have nearly 20 teams and almost 100 participants! Stay tuned each week for an update on the standings.

The top three teams will choose a charity donation of $1,500, $1,000 and $500. The team winners are based on the percentage of goal achieved so any level exerciser is in the running!

The top ten point earners each receive a $25.00 gift card.

There are healthy habit bonus points we’ll list each week, so even if you are not in the challenge, try them out!

item.title: Farmers Market is Coming to the Stage Street Cafe!
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description:
The Stage Street Café will be featuring a Farmers Market throughout the Summer and into the Fall season. Every Wednesday starting, 6/18, you will have the convenience of purchasing seasonal offerings of farm fresh fruits and vegetables.
Advantages to buying at a local Farmers Market: · It’s healthier and more sustainable to eat food that is locally grown. · [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Stage Street Café will be featuring a Farmers Market throughout the Summer and into the Fall season.

Every Wednesday starting, 6/18, you will have the convenience of purchasing seasonal offerings of farm fresh fruits and vegetables.

Advantages to buying at a local Farmers Market:

· It’s healthier and more sustainable to eat food that is locally grown.

· Fruits and vegetables are fresher, and therefore, taste better.

· You’re supporting local farmers and small business owners.

· It helps to build community in your city, town or neighborhood.

item.title: Making friends with the Mahwah Fire Department
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: This past Wednesday evening, we invited the entire Mahwah volunteer Fire Department to 933 Inspiration. We walked them through our evacuation plan and then the building. This was a great way to establish a partnership with the emergency personnel so we can work toward getting them the information they need in case of an emergency. This will enable them to [...]
item.content:encoded: This past Wednesday evening, we invited the entire Mahwah volunteer Fire Department to 933 Inspiration. We walked them through our evacuation plan and then the building. This was a great way to establish a partnership with the emergency personnel so we can work toward getting them the information they need in case of an emergency. This will enable them to react quicker keeping our associates safer.

item.title: Dressbarn Summer Associates, 2014
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: Shirley Aramayo Ball State University 2017 Chemistry & Pre-Pharmacy, Spanish & Fashion Minor Shirley will be working in the Customer Experience Center this summer. She hopes to meet new and interesting people who can influence her on career path along with gaining greater knowledge about the Customer Experience department. In her spare time she enjoys doing arts & [...]
item.content:encoded:
Shirley Aramayo

Ball State University 2017

Chemistry & Pre-Pharmacy, Spanish & Fashion Minor

Shirley will be working in the Customer Experience Center this summer. She hopes to meet new and interesting people who can influence her on career path along with gaining greater knowledge about the Customer Experience department. In her spare time she enjoys doing arts & crafts and shopping. Shirley is the biggest chemistry nerd you will ever meet! She will eat just about anything and loves to try new things.

 

McKenzie Banahan

Ohio State University 2017

Environmental Engineering

McKenzie will be joining the Customer Experience team with the hopes of gaining experience and an idea of working in a business, such as dressbarn. She enjoys hanging out with her friends and in her spare time she plays the guitar, paints or likes to do interior decorating. Her future goals are to graduate college, find a successful job and eventually start a family.

 

 

 

Ciara Breen

South Dakota School of Mines and Technology 2015

Industrial Engineering

Ciara is a current dressbarn Sales Associate and will be joining the Asset Protection team this summer. She hopes to sharpen her knowledge and gain new skills. Some hobbies include shooting guns, traveling and following sports. Her future goal is to be a life-long learner by constantly growing and experiencing new things. Ciara has been to Ireland nine 9 times, and has extensive family there.

 

Kayla Cook

Ramapo College 2015

Visual Communication Design

Kayla will be joining us this summer as the Creative Summer Associate on the Brand Creative team. She hopes to gain real world work experience, as well as gaining more knowledge of graphic design. Kayla’s future goal is be a Graphic Designer in the field of magazines, fashion or advertising. She enjoys drawing, photography and going to concerts. Kayla has been to almost 40 concerts within the past 6 years.

 

Tiffany Dao

Montclair State University 2014

Fashion Studies

Tiffany will be joining the Visual Merchandising team in the hopes of gaining more knowledge from the corporate side as opposed to the retail side. She would like to open her own boutique one day. Tiffany enjoys traveling, singing, watching movies, cooking and many more activities. She currently works at Kate Spade as a sales associate.

 

 

Kimberly Dinh

Rutgers University 2014

Human Resources Management & Psychology

Kimberly will be working in the Human Resources department within a rotation program. She is currently transitioning to graduate school and hopes to become an HR Generalist in the future. Tiffany wants to gain a deeper understanding of HR in the retail aspect during this program. She loves to sing jazz and scat, along with spending quality time with her friends and family.

 

 

Abby Goettler

University of Pennsylvania 2016

Mathematics

Abby will be joining the Merchandise Analysis team this summer with the hopes of exploring the retail industry, aiding her on her career choice. She is currently finishing her degree in math, but is looking to begin her studies in marketing and operations as well. Abby enjoys singing, listening to music and skiing. An interesting fact about Abby is that she transferred schools after her freshman year in college.

 

 

Jacquelynn Guglielmo

The Fashion Institute of Technology 2015

Fashion Merchandising Management

Jacquelynn hopes to analyze and understand the merchandising aspect of dressbarn’s business by working with the Merchandising team this summer. She enjoys spending time on the beach with her friends and family. Her future goal is to become a product developer at a private label. Jacquelynn lived in Florence, Italy for five months last fall during her study abroad program.

 

Rita Kennedy

University of Scranton 2014

Business Administration

Rita will be joining the Visual Merchandising department hoping to gain new experiences and knowledge. She hopes to build a stable career and use her free time for traveling. Rita enjoys doing yoga and trying out new baking recipes for her friends and family. An interesting fact about Rita is that she has been skydiving and bungee jumping.

 

 

Samantha Lubatkin

University at Buffalo, SUNY 2017

Marketing

Samantha will be joining the Energy Marketing team this summer. She hopes to gain experience that she can apply to her classes and later on after college, as well as enhancing her learning abilities. Samantha enjoys dancing and writing. She would like to go into fashion and become a published author. She is currently in the middle of writing a novel and is very interested in health and nutrition.

 

 

Shawn Pan

Swarthmore College 2017

Computer Science

Shawn recently did an externship with dressbarn this past winter, and he will be returning to join the Finance team this summer. His goal is to gain experience and knowledge about the professional world, in order to gain a better sense of his future pursuits and career path. Shawn enjoys swimming, reading and exercising. An interesting fact about Shawn is that he has traveled to Cuba.

 

Stephanie Roman

Marist College 2015

Fashion Merchandising

Stephanie had interned with dressbarn last summer and will be joining us again on the Merchandising team. She hopes to gain more knowledge about what it takes to be a buyer. Stephanie hopes to become a buyer in the future and wants to further her knowledge of how the fashion industry operates. She enjoys shopping and traveling. Stephanie has studied abroad for a semester in London.

 

Rachel Rudd

Elon University 2016

Marketing

Rachel hopes to gain experience working in a corporate office this summer. She will be working in the Customer Experience Center along with three other summer associates. Her future goal is to work in retail marketing. Rachel enjoys playing tennis and traveling. She is fluent in Spanish and is planning to spend a semester abroad in Barcelona this fall.

 

 

Patrick Saardi

Rutgers University 2016

Finance

Patrick will be joining as the Inventory & Sales Audit Summer Associate this summer. He plans to become a successful businessman and in turn give back to charities. He hopes to gain valuable experience and make immediate contributions to the company in any way he can. Patrick loves to cook, play basketball and watch The New York Knicks with his family. An interesting fact about Patrick is that he is absolutely horrible at ice skating.

 

Kristie Sudol

Rowan University 2017

Public Relations

Kristie will be working in the Customer Experience Center and hopes to gain experience and knowledge in order to expand her skills and network. Her future goal is to work for a major fashion company and to also earn her master’s in marketing, along with traveling the world. Kristie enjoys anything that has to do with fashion and likes to relax on the beach. She is a risk taker and went to college in Boston her freshman year without knowing anyone in the city.

item.title: Everyday Acts of Amazingness Wall
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: Everyday Acts of Amazingness Wall We loved our Inspiration Hall at Suffern and all of the activity that it received. Now that we have settled in to our new home, we have found the perfect space to continue to share comments throughout the organization on our Everyday Acts of Amazingness Wall (located outside of the Stage Street Café). [...]
item.content:encoded:
Everyday Acts of Amazingness Wall

We loved our Inspiration Hall at Suffern and all of the activity that it received. Now that we have settled in to our new home, we have found the perfect space to continue to share comments throughout the organization on our Everyday Acts of Amazingness Wall (located outside of the Stage Street Café). You can continue to write comments and acknowledge someone who has inspired – just grab a piece of chalk!

At the end of the month we will gather all of the comments and recognize our Associates of the Month from the comments shared on the wall and from our intranet site under You’re A STAR!

Don’t forget to check out photos from all of our company events via the Photo Gallery on our new home office intranet site http://10.24.32.45/photo-galleries/.

item.title: Sign-Up for our “Fit into Summer” Active for Life 10 Week Activity Challenge
item.dc:creator: Foster Bass
item.description: Are you ready to move more this summer? Calling all PARTICIPANTS and TEAM LEADERS for our “Fit Into Summer ” 10 Week Activity Challenge sponsored by the American Cancer Society’s Active for Life program Last year’s challenge was such a success we are bringing it back – and did you know that one of our team winners, the Tinkerbells, was [...]
item.content:encoded:
Are you ready to move more this summer?

Calling all PARTICIPANTS and TEAM LEADERS for our “Fit Into Summer ” 10 Week Activity Challenge sponsored by the American Cancer Society’s Active for Life program

Last year’s challenge was such a success we are bringing it back – and did you know that one of our team winners, the Tinkerbells, was a team of DL’s so you don’t need to be at the home office to participate! Let’s encourage and motivate each other to move more in our daily lives!

Registration deadline is Friday, June 20th. Kickoff is Monday, June 23rd

CLICK HERE if you are interested in signing up.

Set goals, track points and compete with coworkers. Five members per team, max. Charity donations and prizes given! CLICK HERE for more details

We are holding a general info session Tuesday, June 10th at 2:00pm in the Downstairs Atrium

A final registration email will be sent out prior to the informational meeting. Feel free to contact Katherine with any other questions katherine.adamenko@ascenaretail.com
